conversations.topic: Planes para el fin de semana

dialog.speaker: Sofía
dialog.spanish: ¿Qué te gusta hacer el fin de semana?
dialog.english: What do you like to do on the weekend?

dialog.speaker: Marco
dialog.spanish: Me gusta mucho ver películas. Prefiero ver una película que leer un libro.
dialog.english: I really like to watch movies. I prefer watching a movie to reading a book.

dialog.speaker: Sofía
dialog.spanish: A mí me gusta leer más que ver películas. Pienso que los libros son más interesantes.
dialog.english: I like to read more than watch movies. I think books are more interesting.

dialog.speaker: Marco
dialog.spanish: Bueno, tal vez podemos hacer las dos cosas. Podemos leer y después ver una película.
dialog.english: Well, maybe we can do both things. We can read and then watch a movie.

dialog.speaker: Sofía
dialog.spanish: ¡Me parece una buena idea!
dialog.english: That sounds like a good idea to me!

questions.question: ¿Qué significa 'Yo prefiero ver una película'?
options: I prefer to watch a movie
questions.answer: I prefer to watch a movie

dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: Tengo hambre. ¿Qué quieres comer?
dialog.english: I'm hungry. What do you want to eat?

dialog.speaker: David
dialog.spanish: Yo quiero pizza. Me gusta la pizza más que la pasta.
dialog.english: I want pizza. I like pizza more than pasta.

dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: Yo no quiero pizza. Prefiero ir a un restaurante de comida mexicana.
dialog.english: I don't want pizza. I prefer to go to a Mexican food restaurant.

dialog.speaker: David
dialog.spanish: Hmm. Está bien. Yo también quiero comida mexicana, pero la pizza es mi favorita.
dialog.english: Hmm. Okay. I also want Mexican food, but pizza is my favorite.

dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: ¡Perfecto! Vamos al restaurante mexicano de la esquina.
dialog.english: Perfect! Let's go to the Mexican restaurant on the corner.

dialog.speaker: Carlos
dialog.spanish: ¿Qué piensas de la música rock?
dialog.english: What do you think about rock music?

dialog.speaker: Ana
dialog.spanish: Yo creo que es muy ruidosa. Prefiero la música clásica.
dialog.english: I believe it's very loud. I prefer classical music.

dialog.speaker: Carlos
dialog.spanish: En mi opinión, la música rock es la mejor. Me gusta el ritmo rápido.
dialog.english: In my opinion, rock music is the best. I like the fast rhythm.

dialog.speaker: Ana
dialog.spanish: Bueno, tal vez depende del momento. Yo escucho rock a veces.
dialog.english: Well, maybe it depends on the moment. I listen to rock sometimes.

dialog.speaker: Carlos
dialog.spanish: ¡Qué bien! A mí también me gusta la música clásica.
dialog.english: How nice! I also like classical music.

questions.question: ¿Qué piensa Carlos sobre la música rock?

dialog.speaker: María
dialog.spanish: ¿Qué quieres hacer después de la universidad?
dialog.english: What do you want to do after university?

dialog.speaker: Pablo
dialog.spanish: Quiero viajar por el mundo. Prefiero viajar que trabajar en una oficina.
dialog.english: I want to travel the world. I prefer to travel than to work in an office.

dialog.speaker: María
dialog.spanish: Yo no quiero viajar. Yo quiero un trabajo estable. Creo que es más importante.
dialog.english: I don't want to travel. I want a stable job. I believe it's more important.

dialog.speaker: Pablo
dialog.spanish: Entiendo tu opinión, pero yo pienso que las experiencias son más valiosas que el dinero.
dialog.english: I understand your opinion, but I think experiences are more valuable than money.

dialog.speaker: María
dialog.spanish: Tal vez tienes razón. Pero yo prefiero estar segura.
dialog.english: Maybe you're right. But I prefer to be secure.

questions.question: ¿Qué quiere hacer Pablo después de la universidad?

dialog.speaker: Carmen
dialog.spanish: Me gusta esta camisa, pero quiero una que sea más barata.
dialog.english: I like this shirt, but I want one that is cheaper.

dialog.speaker: Lucía
dialog.spanish: Yo también. Creo que la ropa es muy cara en esta tienda.
dialog.english: Me too. I think the clothes are very expensive in this store.

dialog.speaker: Carmen
dialog.spanish: Sí. Yo prefiero comprar en la otra tienda. Los precios son mejores allí.
dialog.english: Yes. I prefer to shop at the other store. The prices are better there.

dialog.speaker: Lucía
dialog.spanish: ¡Qué buena idea! Vamos allá. No quiero gastar mucho dinero.
dialog.english: What a good idea! Let's go there. I don't want to spend a lot of money.

dialog.speaker: Carmen
dialog.spanish: Me parece bien. A mí me gusta ahorrar.
dialog.english: That sounds good to me. I like to save money.

questions.question: ¿Por qué prefieren la otra tienda?
options: Porque la ropa es más bonita

questions.question: ¿Qué significa 'No quiero gastar mucho dinero'?
options: I want to spend a lot of money
I don't want to spend a lot of money
questions.answer: I don't want to spend a lot of money

sentences.spanish: En mi opinión, la comida mexicana es la mejor. Me gustan los tacos más que cualquier otra cosa.
sentences.english: In my opinion, Mexican food is the best. I like tacos more than anything else.

sentences.spanish: Cuando voy a un restaurante, siempre prefiero pedir tacos al pastor. Me encantan.
sentences.english: When I go to a restaurant, I always prefer to order tacos al pastor. I love them.

sentences.spanish: También me gustan las quesadillas, pero no las quiero tanto como los tacos.
sentences.english: I also like quesadillas, but I don't want them as much as tacos.

sentences.spanish: Yo creo que la comida es más rica cuando la comes con amigos.
sentences.english: I believe that food is more delicious when you eat it with friends.

sentences.spanish: Por eso, me gusta invitar a mis amigos a comer tacos conmigo.
sentences.english: For that reason, I like to invite my friends to eat tacos with me.

sentences.spanish: Para mí, el fin de semana ideal es estar en casa. Yo prefiero descansar.
sentences.english: For me, the ideal weekend is to be at home. I prefer to rest.

sentences.spanish: Me gusta dormir hasta tarde. No quiero levantarme temprano los sábados.
sentences.english: I like to sleep in late. I don't want to get up early on Saturdays.

sentences.spanish: Pienso que es importante relajarse. Por eso, me gusta leer un libro y escuchar música.
sentences.english: I think it's important to relax. Because of that, I like to read a book and listen to music.

sentences.spanish: A veces, mis amigos quieren ir de fiesta, pero yo prefiero quedarme en casa. Soy feliz así.
sentences.english: Sometimes, my friends want to go partying, but I prefer to stay home. I am happy that way.

sentences.spanish: El domingo, quiero cocinar algo delicioso. Me gusta mucho cocinar.
sentences.english: On Sunday, I want to cook something delicious. I really like to cook.

sentences.spanish: Mi amigo Juan tiene muchas opiniones. Él piensa que el fútbol es el mejor deporte.
sentences.english: My friend Juan has many opinions. He thinks that soccer is the best sport.

sentences.spanish: Él prefiere ver un partido de fútbol que cualquier otra cosa en la televisión.
sentences.english: He prefers to watch a soccer game than anything else on television.

sentences.spanish: Yo no creo que el fútbol sea el mejor. Me gusta el baloncesto más que el fútbol.
sentences.english: I don't believe soccer is the best. I like basketball more than soccer.

sentences.spanish: Juan quiere ser un jugador de fútbol profesional. Pienso que es un gran sueño.
sentences.english: Juan wants to be a professional soccer player. I think it's a great dream.

sentences.spanish: Yo prefiero jugar baloncesto, pero respeto lo que él quiere y piensa.
sentences.english: I prefer to play basketball, but I respect what he wants and thinks.

speaking.title: Dando Opiniones
speaking.description: Preguntas y respuestas para expresar gustos, preferencias y creencias en español.

question.english: Do you like Chinese food?

answer.spanish: Sí, me gusta mucho.
answer.english: Yes, I like it a lot.

question.english: What do you think of this book?

answer.spanish: Pienso que es muy interesante.
answer.english: I think it's very interesting.

question.english: What do you prefer, coffee or tea?

answer.spanish: Yo prefiero el café, por favor.
answer.english: I prefer coffee, please.

question.english: What do you want for dinner?

answer.spanish: Quiero una ensalada y pollo.
answer.english: I want a salad and chicken.

question.english: Do you like sports?

answer.spanish: Sí, me gustan mucho los deportes.
answer.english: Yes, I really like sports.

question.spanish: En tu opinión, ¿cuál es la mejor película?
question.english: In your opinion, what is the best movie?

answer.spanish: En mi opinión, la mejor película es 'Star Wars'.
answer.english: In my opinion, the best movie is 'Star Wars'.

question.english: Do you believe it's easy to learn Spanish?

answer.spanish: Yo creo que es un poco difícil.
answer.english: I believe it's a little difficult.

question.english: Do you prefer summer or winter?

answer.spanish: Prefiero el verano, es más divertido.
answer.english: I prefer summer, it's more fun.

question.english: What do you like about this city?

answer.spanish: Me gustan los parques y los restaurantes.
answer.english: I like the parks and the restaurants.

question.english: What do you think about the new music?

answer.spanish: Pienso que es muy moderna y diferente.
answer.english: I think it's very modern and different.

question.spanish: En mi opinión, el restaurante es muy caro. ¿Qué piensas tú?
question.english: In my opinion, the restaurant is very expensive. What do you think?

answer.spanish: Yo creo que sí. Es un poco caro.
answer.english: I believe so. It's a little expensive.

question.spanish: ¿Quieres ir al cine o al teatro?
question.english: Do you want to go to the cinema or the theater?

answer.spanish: Yo quiero ir al cine.
answer.english: I want to go to the cinema.

question.english: Do you like the clothes I bought?

answer.spanish: Claro que sí, me gustan mucho.
answer.english: Of course, I like them a lot.

question.spanish: ¿Qué prefieres, la ciudad o el campo?
question.english: What do you prefer, the city or the countryside?

answer.spanish: Prefiero la ciudad, hay más cosas que hacer.
answer.english: I prefer the city, there are more things to do.

question.english: Do you want more water?

answer.spanish: Sí, quiero más, por favor.
answer.english: Yes, I want more, please.

question.english: What do you think about the vacation?

answer.spanish: Creo que son muy divertidas.
answer.english: I believe they are very fun.

question.english: Do you like the plan?

answer.spanish: Sí, me gusta mucho el plan.
answer.english: Yes, I really like the plan.

question.english: What do you want as a gift?

answer.spanish: Quiero un libro y una tarjeta.
answer.english: I want a book and a card.

question.english: What do you prefer for breakfast?

answer.spanish: Prefiero comer huevos y pan.
answer.english: I prefer to eat eggs and bread.

question.english: Do you believe the idea is good?

answer.spanish: Sí, yo creo que la idea es muy buena.
answer.english: Yes, I believe the idea is very good.
